Articles.Content: I am just curious about how long people have had KSP.
November 2015

December-January 2014-2015.  I joined the forums in March.

Edited March 10, 2016 by Guest

22 Jan. 2014, per my profile, but I think I started playing KSP regularly and lurking on the forum sometime in the middle of 2013. I first played the game in 2012 at the latest, but dropped it for a while because it was comparatively feature-poor back then and thus a lot less addictive.
July 2011, well before there was a Mun   .  KSP has come a long way since then!
May of 2013

12/27/14

I was snowed in and decided to give myself a belated Christmas present.

I often came to the forums looking for advice.  Seems every problem I ran into, someone had encountered before, so I almost always found the answer here.

Back in 2011 before there was the Mun, back then I was just messing around with rockets. It wasn't until late 2012 that I realized you could press "m" for orbital map, before that I was able to "land" on the moon ONCE and that was with eyeballing the moon, aiming, shooting, retry, retry, retry, retry [...] and FINALLY smash into the moon! A feat I believe is still pretty hard to this day.
Around June 20th, right before 0.21 hit. Joined here in May of last year.
I joined in July 2013, less than a month after getting the game, and just a couple months after the "great forum wipe" that I'm not at all sad I missed

I hopped on right after the Mun was added and all we had were tailfins to land there with.  One of my first missions rewarded me with this wonderful shot that I shall never forget: 

They were well on their way out of Kerbin SOI.

Though I joined the forums at around November of 2013, I got the game a little later than that, and I don't remember when exactly. I do remember, however, that I got it at 0.22's last moments, as 0.23 was released not too long afterward.

Ah, I remember the times I struggled on how to go to the Mun in the Demo, and made giant hourglass rockets trying in vain to reach it... Good times.
July 2014

I got the demo in the second week the game was out (early July 2011), then bought the game a few weeks later. I seriously can't believe I've been playing for nearly 5 years! Thing is, I only joined the forums early this year

Did anyone else start playing in 2011?

I play KSP since 0.20 and joined the forums in January 2014. KSP made it into the top ten of my alltime favorite games with absolute ease...

I still play some hours a week, and i am looking forward to 1.1 and many new SPACE & SCIENCE adventures in the future.
July 15th 2013, 8:48am GMT+1
15th July 2011, I had gotten a laptop for my 11th birthday and found this space game (i googled "space program simulator" and ksp was the first one I found that peaked my interest)

Back in February 13th, 2014, around 5:00 PM. My mom just got her tax refund and seeing as I watched this on YouTube I got obsessed and I wanted this game. It is also when I got Steam for the first time. I joined the forums the same day next year
On the seventh of June 2013, I purchased the game and got an account on the forums.
A day after .21 came out is when i got ksp via steam
Christmas 2014, as a gift from my brother. All my rockets ended up being massive constructions that went nowhere.

Apr 23, 2012. Bought the game months before that though, back before the Mun, before we had more than, what, like 20 parts total to play with? 

Ah, you know what? Those old parts memorials at the KSC and Island hangars? I used to play with those.  Ah those were the days, when the only way to fly a plane was to fly a rocket sideways.  There weren't no newfangled SAS nonsense, and patched conics? Maneuver nodes? Ha, I say! And also, no. No there weren't. 

Hasn't been THAT long, but wow do all these versions have a way of making me feel old now!
